messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Smash Brothers Wii
messages.msgSnippet: Smash Bros. seems to be a game all kids enjoy.  My 3...12,9 and 6 all love it.  Susan ________________________________ From: balickgoodmanfamily
messages.messageBody:
Smash Bros. seems to be a game all kids enjoy.  My 3...12,9 and 6 all love it. 
Susan




________________________________
From: balickgoodmanfamily <catonsvillenanny@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, March 23, 2009 11:36:29 AM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Smash Brothers Wii


Hello,

My son will be 6 next week and wanted to get super smash brothers wii for his birthday. He plays this game all the time on a friend's nintendo 64.

When we looked at the game, we noticed it had a teen rating. So, am wondering, does anyone have younger kids who play this? He'd be fine with the graphics (especially since he already plays), but would probably have a hard time if the skill level was different from other Mario Games. We tried Dance, Dance Revolution and he couldn't follow the steps...

Thanks to anyone who plays and knows this game. My son is a huge fan.

Thanks, Lyssa







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re:Smash Brothers Wii
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks everyone for your comments!  We got the game last night and look forward to my son playing...Me?  I m not so good, but I enjoy watching and learning
messages.messageBody:
Thanks everyone for your comments!  We got the game last night and look forward to my son playing...Me?  I'm not so good, but I enjoy watching and learning from my son.

Take care, Lyssa






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Smash Brothers Wii
messages.msgSnippet: My 6 year old plays this game too and one of his friends is 5 and he showed him how to play and no problem. I am not good at it  but I have fun playing!
messages.messageBody:
My 6 year old plays this game too and one of his friends is 5 and he showed him how to play and no problem.
I am not good at it  but I have fun playing!
 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Smash Brothers Wii
messages.msgSnippet: ... my kids are 3,5,6,7 and they play it quite abit.    the 3 year old doesnt know what he is doing really but it doesnt stop him.  i think the teen rating is
messages.messageBody:
>
> My son will be 6 next week and wanted to get super smash brothers wii for his birthday. He plays this game all the time on a friend's nintendo 64.
>
> When we looked at the game, we noticed it had a teen rating. So, am wondering, does anyone have younger kids who play this? He'd be fine with the graphics (especially since he already plays), but would probably have a hard time if the skill level was different from other Mario Games. We tried Dance, Dance Revolution and he couldn't follow the steps...
>
my kids are 3,5,6,7 and they play it quite abit. the 3 year old doesnt know what he is doing really but it doesnt stop him. i think the teen rating is due to the fact that it a little more graphic than the 64 version and that is a fighting game. but my two older boys got the game when they were 5 and 6 and dont have any trouble playing it.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Smash Brothers Wii
messages.msgSnippet: Our younger boys, five and seven, have never had a problem with this game. They kick my hiney at it. lol! Melissa Mom to Joshua, Breanna, Emily, Rachel,
messages.messageBody:
Our younger boys, five and seven, have never had a problem with this
game.
They kick my hiney at it. lol!
Melissa
Mom to Joshua, Breanna, Emily, Rachel, Samuel, Daniel and Avari
Wife to Zane

blog me at
http://startlinglives.blogspot.com/
http://startlinglives365.blogspot.com
